Web Developer/E-commerce

Submitted by Anonymous (not verified) on Tue, 04/17/2012 - 12:02

JOB DESCRIPTION
The Web Developer will have overall responsibility for working on a variety of projects primarily involved in web site design, functionality, and development. This person will create new programs based on management vision and customer demands while simultaneously maintaining our e-commerce site and customer web sites. The developer will work closely with our design team for interface design and appearance. The significance of this position is rapidly increasing as web sales for our company have grown by 114% since 2008 and produces more than 50% of our overall company volume. We are looking for a sharp, driven individual who can keep up with the fast-paced nature of the e-commerce development.

Essential Job Functions:
- Design, maintain, and upgrade company website and other electronic publications and applications.
- Code and maintain all company written applications.
- Work with the Marketing Department and Vice President to determine style and approach of web projects.
- Work with the IS Manager to develop solutions to increase efficiencies and to enhance the company's website.
- Coordinate preparation of illustrative materials from artists and vendors.
- Ensure that all design elements, templates and finished solutions work within a variety of browser types and screen settings along with the constraints set by development and design.
- Provide design elements, comps, templates, and finished solutions.
- Problem-solve and respond to co-worker or customer questions and/or issues, and react as necessary.
- Recommend changes to the systems or procedures to improve the quality of client websites.
- Maintain documentation for web site and web application changes made.
- Stay abreast of the latest in website security design/features to ensure that our website is secure and our customer's privacy is protected.
- Provide assistance to others in the IT department as required.

General Requirements:
- Experience in developing e-commerce sites with a track record of delivering functional maintenance releases.
- Advanced understanding of the open source Postgres and MySQL database servers and SQL programming.
- Working knowledge of PHP, HTML, CSS, XML, and JavaScript.
- Experience in socket programming.
- Basic knowledge of the Apache web server and Python.
- Solid understanding of object oriented programming methods and principals.
- Knowledgeable in the areas of web protocols, programming requirements and web security issues.
- Extensive experience in troubleshooting web/program functionality and resolving 'bugs'.
- Strong planning and self-organization; resourceful, tenacious and have the ability to meet established deadlines.
- Create formal technical / system documentation to standards and conventions
- 2+ years of experience in web design.
- Experience in additional programming languages a plus.

Visit http://www.onestopinc.com/about/employment/job/13 to apply or email your resume to hr@onestopinc.com
